input: Which of the following statements is/are correct? P. A registered voter in India can contest an election to Lok Sabha from any constituency in India. Q. As per the Representation of the People Act, 1951, if a person is convicted of any offence and sentenced to an imprisonment of 2 years or more, he will be disqualified to contest election. Select the correct answer using the codes given below
explanation: A registered voter in India can contest an election to Lok Sabha from any constituency in India except autonomous Districts of Assam, Lakshadweep and Sikkim. According to Section 8 of Representation of Peoples Act 1951,a person convicted of any offence and sentenced to imprisonment for not less than two years [other than any offence referred to in sub-section (a) or sub-section (b) ] shall be disqualified from the date of such conviction and shall continue to be disqualified for a further period of six years since his release.
